definitions.definition: making goods or growing crops, especially in large quantities

examples.text: The aim was to maximize the machine’s productive capacity.
The bush must be pruned to remain productive.
My time spent in the library was very productive.
I just wish he would do something productive with his life.
Internet sources have proved extremely productive.
It makes them feel productive even if it is not a paying job.

definitions.definition: resulting in something or causing something

examples.text: a play productive of the strongest emotions

wordOrigin: early 17th cent.: from French productif, -ive or late Latin productivus, from product- ‘brought forth’, from the verb producere, from pro- ‘forward’ + ducere ‘to lead’.
